Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the comparison between anti-vaxxers and Jews in the Holocaust by attributing a statement to Karen Andrews that she did not make.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that Karen Andrews made the statement comparing anti-vaxxers to Jews in the Holocaust.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the image and information shared by Karen Andrews were part of a federal government campaign to promote a Covid-19 vaccine scheme, without providing concrete evidence.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the image and text attributed to Karen Andrews were digitally altered and not present in her original post.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the claim, which is that the image and text were manipulated and falsely attributed to Karen Andrews for political or propaganda purposes.
